author: Anne Christine Persson
title: Henrik Vibskov—Fabricate, Daelim Museum Seoul
text:
9 View the slideshow
Photo: Courtesy of Daelim Museum
If you happen to be in South Korea at some point before the end of the year, you should make your way to the Daelim Museum in Seoul. A newly opened exhibition features the best of one of Denmark’s most internationally renowned designers, Henrik Vibskov. To limit Vibskov only to fashion design would not be quite right, as he dabbles in music and art as well—while also being the owner of a coffee shop. His fashion shows probably describe him best, as he is known for his use of iconoclastic shock tactics to create unique presentations, drawing attention and controversy in equal measure with each new collection. This exhibit features more than 300 works, including a re-created set design from one his shows and design highlights from many of his collections.
Henrik Vibskov—Fabricate will be on view until December 31 at the Daelim Museum, Seoul.
For more information, visit www.henrikvibskov.com .
